messages.subject: Re: L&L Conference
messages.msgSnippet: Well, at least I wrote *should*!  Cheryl s been up to her ears with getting the handbook to the printer. She will have it up as soon as she can! It will
messages.messageBody:
<G> Well, at least I wrote *should*! <G>

Cheryl's been up to her ears with getting the handbook to the printer. She will have it up as soon as she can!

It will be on the schedule page, broken down by days and hours and rooms.

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
October 6-9, 2005
http://liveandlearnconference.org

Just checked - I'm not seeing the funshop schedule (8:28 pm EDT). Is
it up and I'm not looking in the right place - I checked the Schedule
page? I can't wait to add that to my spreadsheet (lol) so we can sort
out who wants to go where and when and all like that.

--Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] L&L Conference
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Rod Thomas  Does anyone know, is it best to fly into St. Louis for the conference? -=-=-=- There is a small airport in
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Rod Thomas <flyerrod@...>

Does anyone know, is it best to fly into St. Louis for the conference?

-=-=-=-
There is a small airport in O'Fallon, IL. But it's new, and I have no personal experience with it.
Lambert Field (St Louis Airport) is the major hub and where the speakers are flying into.
-=-=-=-=-
And is there a Days Inn nearby?
-=-=-=-

I have no idea. There's a Drury, a Ramada, a Fairfield, and a Hampton all within walking distance.
-=-=-=-=-
What are the best days to go if I can
only go for 3 of the 4?

-=-=-=-=-

You might want to take a look at the schedule and find what suits your family best.
The funshop schedule *should* be up TODAY!

~Kelly


Kelly LovejoyConference CoordinatorLive and Learn Unschooling ConferenceOctober 6-9, 2005http://liveandlearnconference.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Rue's book is great
messages.messageBody:
<Hi Rue. I LOVE YOUR BOOK. I finished it in one night. I am already
recommending it to friends. Great job and thanks so much for sharing your
insight.
Crystal>

Rue,

I totally agree. Your book is so nourishing to a new unschoolers heart. I
have been looking forward to reading it every night and I am almost done.
My husband has been asking for a book to read--and I have changed my mind
about 10 times about which book to give him (I've probably read about 30 so
far). This is it! Your book is full of thoughtful, loving wisdom. I love
that you have no axe to grind--just the simple truth of your joyous life.
Thank you so much.

gratefully,

Jena Walter

Home school education

school education

messages.messageBody:
Hi Rue. I LOVE YOUR BOOK. I finished it in one night. I am already
recommending it to friends. Great job and thanks so much for sharing your
insight.
Crystal
